short_discription: Computer science M.Sc. at HAW Hamburg, with hands-on experience in software development and a passion for cutting-edge technology.
about_section_1: Hi, I’m Kilian — computer science student at HAW Hamburg with a solide foundation in programming languages such as C, Rust, Java, Kotlin, Dart, Python, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
about_section_2: I’ve got experience in both frontend and backend development with frameworks and tools such as React, Next.js, Svelte, Tailwindcss, Flutter, and Spring Boot. I also have experience working with several sql databases.
about_section_3: Recently, I worked at itestra GmbH as a student software developer, where I contributed to a large-scale insurance project. My work included migrating legacy C code to Java, building UIs with React and developing backend services using Spring Boot. I was also involved in designing database schemas, writing unit and integration tests, and working with CI/CD pipelines to ensure smooth and reliable deployments. At university, I am currently specializing in machine learning and robotics.
about_section_4: Outside of work and university, I love tinkering with personal projects, like running my own home server, my Nixos configuration and several unfinished projects. Projects which i "finished" are available on my GitHub. When I’m not coding, you’ll probably find me at concerts, on the football field, or enjoying winter sports.
bachelor_thesis_despriction: Developed and tested zero-/few-shot approaches using Llama 3.3 to automatically extract software requirements from documentation, achieving promising results that can support traditional requirements analysis
student_software_developer_description: Migrated legacy C code to Java, built user interfaces with React and Next.js, developed backend services with Spring Boot, and helped design database schemas while ensuring quality through testing and CI/CD, agile software development, UI/UX consulting and design, customer communication
